focus_area_list: Manager of technical documentation for the Pure Storage Cloud Native Business Unit (CNBU), responsible for the Portworx product line
Member of the Pure Storage generative AI governance council
Hired and developed a team of full-time writers in both the US and India to support a growing Portworx product line: Portworx Data Services, Portworx Backup as-a-Service, Portworx Central On-prem
Developed an internal course, trained writers how to contribute using a docs-as-code workflow using an example repository and custom-made teaching materials

Planned and defined a strategic roadmap and documentation strategy that meets customers needs, adheres to budgetary requirements, and utilizes automation and AI to improve accuracy and multiply efficiency
Prototyped and designed worklows using generative AI as part of the Pure Storage AI governance council
Managed direct reports using Jira and GitHub to define and triage work, delegate tasks, and monitor progress
Rearchitected docs.portworx.com, removing maintenance burden and centralizing content onto one site for a 'single pane of glass' experience
Built custom authoring tools as react components: text variables, includes with conditional content, link cards, text highlights, a feedback form
Built a table automation tool for parsing upstream source data for the pxctl command into a reference, ensuring that this reference will remain up-to-date forever
Built a custom data file and parser for storing reference data in a single location and automating data pulls anywhere desired in documentation, making reference data easier to maintain
Built an authoring workflow for planning, writing, and reviewing documentation
Created a style guide and establish standards for documentation contributions using topic-based authoring
Defined job descriptions, worked with recruiting staff to advertise, interview, and hire full-time writers in both the US and India
Authored documentation and release notes for 88 Portworx Enterprise Kubernetes storage platform releases and hotfixes spanning a $27M series C through a $370M exit
Expanded Portworx documentation from a single product to multiple spanning new product lines; launched PX-Backup 1.0 documentation and handed-off further writing to direct report
Enabled support for AsciiDoc alongside Markdown by upgrading static site generator version and refactoring legacy code to address regressions
Expanded documentation architecture to support new independently versioned products through containerization
Refactored Algolia InstantSearch and implemented federated search, allowing users to search and instantly see results across multiple products
Managed GKE cluster ingress and TLS certs, then replaced it with a service to lower maintenance burden
Wrote and maintained support documentation for the Celtra Management Platform
Performed front end development and administrative tasks for support.celtra.com
Created interactive website documentation designs such as animated tables, feedback buttons and forms, and landing pages using Javascript
Wrote and maintained documentation as sole writer for the Red Hat 3scale API Management Platform
Migrated documentation from legacy formats to AsciiDoc and placed into GitLab repositories
Implemented documentation initiatives: modularity, open sourcing

Established a release publications team, designed a release process, and instructed team members on release procedures; during releases, delegated team tasks for product releases on my.vertica.com and oversaw publication operations
Created and maintained documentation for HPE Software cloud products, including backup/restore, connector, and configuration guides
Modernized documentation using topic-based authoring standards
Implemented and reported on analytics for the documentation and community using Googe Analytics

subsection.degree_name: Additional coursework in computer science and networking
